CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings before ORG against GPE and GPE requesting the court to determine the validity of a sale contract concluded between the defendants concerning an apartment in a building partially owned by the applicant and proposing that a note on dispute be entered in ORG . She indicated as the disputed value SIT CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court issued a decision rejecting the applicant ’s proposal to enter a note on dispute in ORG . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE , after several unsuccessful attempts to serve the applicant ’s appeal on the first defendant , the court posted the appeal on the court ’s notice board .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . Following the applicant ’s supervisory appeal to ORG , the court on DATE reported to ORG that the case could not be given priority .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the court to schedule a hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the court to give priority to her claims which she had lodged with the court .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the applicant ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE a third party intervener , ORG , who had in the meantime bought the apartment subject to the proceedings from the first defendant , joined the proceedings by submitting a written statement .
CARDINAL . On DATE the third party intervener lodged a supervisory appeal submitting inter alia that since the proceedings were still pending she was unable to dispose of the apartment .
CARDINAL . The first hearing was scheduled for DATE but was subsequently postponed to CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged written submissions raising the value of the claim to SIT CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first main hearing was held . The court adopted a decision , modifying the value of the claim as requested by the applicant .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged a request for an interim order .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE CARDINAL further main hearings were held . On the latter date the court issued its judgment partially upholding the applicant ’s claim . The decision was served personally on the applicant and the second defendant and to the first defendant and the third party by posting it on the court ’s notice board .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the file to the first instance court instructing the court that the first defendant should be served the documents related to the appeal in accordance with LAW and that the court should also decide on the applicant ’s request for an interim order .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the applicant to pay the court ’s fees and supplement her proposal to issue an interim order .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of DATE and the applicant ’s appeal were served on the first defendant by posting them on the court ’s notice board .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for an interim order . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeals against the judgment of DATE and the decision of CARDINAL DATE . The applicant lodged an appeal on points of law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal on points of law on procedural grounds . It held that ORG wrongly applied LAW in allowing a modification of the disputed value at a later stage of the proceedings . It therefore considered as the disputed value the value that had been indicated by the applicant in her claim and accordingly concluded that therefore the disputed value had not reached the threshold for lodging an appeal on points of law . The applicant lodged a constitutional appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s constitutional appeal . The decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
